summary:
The Nobel Prizes are five awards given each year to people who have made the world better in different ways. They were started by Alfred Nobel in 1895, and the first prizes were given out in 1901. The prizes are for achievements in physics, chemistry, medicine, literature, and peace. There's also a sixth prize for economics, added later.

Winners get a gold medal, a certificate, and a lot of money. The prizes are very respected and considered the highest honor in each field. So far, over 900 people and 25 organizations have won Nobel Prizes.
title: Nobel Prize
